intro: Scaphyglottis imbricata, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb with slender, erect stems that bear narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a raceme, which bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates. Scaphyglottis imbricata is often found in open habitats such as cliffs, slopes, and coastal areas.
